New Records: Shami picked up five wickets to become the leading wicket-taker for India in ODI World Cups
Shubman Gill scored 92, coming close to his maiden World Cup hundred
Key Match Events: Mohammed Shami's second five-wicket haul of the tournament
Shubman Gill and Virat Kohli added 189 for the second wicket
Jasprit Bumrah struck with the first ball of the innings
Mohammed Siraj picked three wickets in his first two overs
Mohammed Shami continued his sensational run, picking his fourth wicket in just his third over
Post-Match Reflections: India became the first team to reach the semifinals of the 2023 World Cup
India's 302-run victory is now their biggest win in one-day internationals
India have been just as clinical in 2023, defeating Australia, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Bangladesh, New Zealand and England
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rohit Sharma was dismissed cheaply by Dilshan Madushanka
Shubman Gill was delighted to watch and scored 92, coming close to his maiden World Cup hundred
Shreyas Iyer came out and played a gem, scoring 82 off 56
Sri Lanka had reached the World Cup after winning the Cricket World Cup qualifiers but their abject display on Thursday was utterly disappointing
Others: India's pacers were ruthless and destroyed the Sri Lankan chase inside the first two overs of their innings
Shami needed just 14 matches to reach 45 wickets while Zaheer and Srinath had finished with 44 wickets in World Cups
India will take on South Africa at the Eden Gardens on November 5
